properties.name: Croissant d'Or
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide 617 Ursulines Ave, New Orleans, LACroissants are flaky, buttery & cheap while the quiche is flaky, buttery & cheap.

properties.name: D.B.A.
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide618 Frenchmen St, New Orleans, LA If the Pottery Barn opened a bar we think it would look something like this.

properties.name: Dauphine Orleans Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide 415 Dauphine St, New Orleans, LAYou can float in the pool and look at the bar, or sit in the bar and look at the pool, or sit by the chairs by the pool (with a drink from the bar).

properties.name: Erin Rose
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide811 Conti St, New Orleans, LAThe atmosphere is old, wooden and comfy and contains some of kind of old-school French Quarter magic.

properties.name: Golden Lantern
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide1239 Royal St, New Orleans, LAThey pour cheap and stiff drinks at this small and quirky bar located in a charming and relatively quiet section of the Quarter.

properties.name: Harrah's Casino
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide512 S. Peters, New Orleans, LAEvery day there\'s a phony brass band parade!

properties.name: Iggy's
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide1943 N Rampart St, New Orleans, LAThis local/neighborhood bar has always held some sort of magic for us that goes back to when it used to be called Katy\'s Underground.

properties.name: Mule's
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide1701 LaHarpe StOver-30 Creole bar with reasonable prices, good conversation and food specials.

properties.name: Napoleon House Bar & Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide 500 Chartres, New Orleans, LAWe come here to escape our friends, relax in the courtyard & drink silently in surroundings that give the word "corrosion" a new and beautiful meaning.

properties.name: Petunia's
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide817 Saint Louis StThe food -- like crepes with fresh fruit and eggs benedict mixed with crab meat -- and coffee are served hot, very hot, by unpretentious waiters.

properties.name: Port of Call
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide838 Esplanade, New Orleans, LAPort of Call (504) 523-0120

properties.name: Rampart Street Food Store
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide 1700 N RampartBest shrimp poboy in town.

properties.name: Razoo Bar & Patio
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide511 Bourbon, New Orleans, LACheesy dance club/meat market that features a competent house band that takes drunken requests.

properties.name: Riverwalk Marketplace
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide1 Poydras St, New Orleans, LAThe Moon Walk & the River Walk are pedestrian areas running along the east bank of the Mississippi.

properties.name: Riverwalk Marketplace
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide1 Poydras St, New Orleans, LA

properties.name: Tan Dinh
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide1705 Lafayette St # B, Gretna, LA One of the best Vietnamese restaurants in the south.

properties.name: The John
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide 2040 Burgundy, New Orleans, LAThe echo that from the high ceilings mixed with the red tinted lighting mixed with the absence of windows mixed with the obscene amounts of alcohol usually inspires chaos and later, regret.

properties.name: The Joint
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide801 Poland Ave, New Orleans, LAEasily the best BBQ in town -- I think they go for Memphis/Mississippi style, as opposed to the Texas style, but anyway, the ribs are great, the potato salad is excellent, and the mac is the best.

properties.name: Union Passenger Terminal
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide1001 Loyola Ave, New Orleans, LAThe Union Passenger Terminal, shared by Amtrak and Greyhound, is somewhat interesting with its 1950s streamlined architecture and a fascinating fresco by Conrad Albrizio that runs the length of the building.

properties.name: Willie Mae's Scotch House
properties.description: Posted by Nolaguide2401 Saint Ann St, New Orleans, LAWillie Mae\'s chicken is delicate, coming out of the fryer almost like a tempura chicken with a little bit of hot pepper kick. No booze.
